result.execSummary:
The defendant Antolin F. Ojeda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs have been paid from defendant's bond.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.   The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case No. 17CF91.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

Court calls case No. 17CF91 and 15CF42.  Defendant Antolin F. Ojeda in court with attorney Daniel W Linehan.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing on sentence credit and jail sentence.  Atty Linehan makes statement and argument on sentence credit.  Atty Tlusty makes statement.  Court orders 228 sentence credit on 17CF91.  Atty Linehan makes statement.  Court orders to amend judgment of conviction in detail as to sentence sentence credit.  Court directs Atty Linehan to give clerk a note as to how sentence credit should be broken down.  Atty Linehan requests to extend time to report to jail to December.  Atty Tlusty makes statement.  Court orders conditional jail time to start December 1, 2018.  Atty Linehan makes statement. Court makes statement. Court adjourned.  Court reconvenes.  Court calls case No. 15CF42.  Atty Linehan requests to modify to 43 days sentence credit and to be time served.  Atty Tlusty does not object.  Court orders sentence credit to be 43 days, which is time served. ba
for Clarification or Amendment of Judgment of Conviction

Defendant Antolin F. Ojeda in court with attorney Daniel W Linehan.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI has been filed.  No inaccuracies of PSI by Attorney Linehan.  Argument by Counsel.  Recess at 1:53 pm.  Reconvene at 2:03 pm.  Statement by Antolin Ojeda. Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 60 days county jail with huber and good time consecutive to 17CF91.  Costs shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning September 1, 2018. Attorney Tlusty has 60 days to determine sentence credit, if any. - rt

Court calls cases 15CM43, 15CF42 and 15TR425.  Defendant Antolin F. Ojeda in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court signs stipulation for 15TR425.  Atty Tlusty placed agreement on record for 15CM43.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; factual basis exists; accepted plea; found DE guilty.  Court dismissed, but read in counts 2, 3 & 4.  Court imposed court costs; DNA surcharge; DNA sample.  Initial appearance for 15CF43 - waived further reading of the complaint; entered a plea of not guilty; PTC set. Atty Tlusty requests $5,000.00 signature bond with conditions of: Booking; no contact with C.M.M. dob: 1-31-86 and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court orders bond as requested. No objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am. - ba

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court. Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not consume or possess controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall have no contact with C.M.M. dob: 1-31-86.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-01-2015 02:30 pm
